intro: [WRONG START] Galsia integrifolia var. ovata, commonly known as the smoothleaf gallesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet, featuring lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and entire. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. Its botanical characteristics include a woody stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and a preference for moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other damp habitats.
